intro: Galium coronatum var. stenophyllum, commonly known as narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite, elliptical leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their mild sedative properties.
